intro: Gingidia grisea, commonly known as the gray ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like ginger and turmeric. The plant features rhizomes that are typically grayish in color, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale green or white in color. The botanical characteristics of Gingidia grisea make it a unique and interesting species within the ginger family.
